p: The manufacturing process for cell-based IIV is similar to egg-based IIVs, but has several advantages over the latter (Fig. 1). Viral production in a cell culture bioreactor is more flexible, more scalable and unaffected by egg shortages. Additionally, recent comparisons have shown that cell-based vaccines provided a moderately higher VE for elderly individuals (≧65 years old) than egg-based vaccines, possibly due to less egg-adapted mutations [ 38].
